abstract: Michael Lynton, the chief of Sony’s filmed entertainment unit, will take charge of the Japan-based company’s operations in the United States, while executives in Japan focus more on the troubled consumer electronics business.
snippet: Michael Lynton, the chief of Sony’s filmed entertainment unit, will take charge of the Japan-based company’s operations in the United States, while executives in Japan focus more on the troubled consumer electronics business.
lead_paragraph: 8:15 p.m. | Updated  LOS ANGELES — Michael Lynton, the chairman and chief executive of Sony’s filmed entertainment unit, will soon take charge of the Japan-based company’s United States operations in an expanded role as chief executive of Sony Corporation of America, according to people who were briefed on the expected change.

headline.main: Lynton Will Take On Expanded Role at Sony in U.S.

byline.original: By Michael Cieply and Ben Sisario
